intro: Picrella, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, including Picrella ciliata and Picrella hirsuta. These plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pale pink petals. They typically grow in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Picrella species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and are relatively drought-tolerant.
